S https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States "United States" . financed enterprises which have invested in southern China https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Southern_China "Southern China" . 15 https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guangdong%E2%80%93Hong_Kong%E2%80%93Macao_Greater_Bay_Area cite note 16

11-chunk_24_-3080686123564836456.chunk_text: 15 https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guangdong%E2%80%93Hong_Kong%E2%80%93Macao_Greater_Bay_Area cite note 16 On 18 February 2019, the Outline Development Plan for the Guangdong–Hong Kong–Macao Greater Bay Area was adopted. The ambitious goal foresees a linkage of the nine cities in Guangdong province's Pearl River Delta https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pearl_River_Delta "Pearl River Delta" , Hong Kong https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hong_Kong "Hong Kong" and Macau https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Macau "Macau" into an integrated economy and world class business hub. 16 https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guangdong%E2%80%93Hong_Kong%E2%80%93Macao_Greater_Bay_Area cite note ReferenceB 17 In addition, it is expected to play a key role in Belt and Road Initiative https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Belt_and_Road_Initiative "Belt and Road Initiative" by connecting southern China with the countries along the 21st Century Maritime Silk Road https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/21st_Century_Maritime_Silk_Road "21st Century Maritime Silk Road" .

11-chunk_25_-7575887681174059026.chunk_text: 16 https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guangdong%E2%80%93Hong_Kong%E2%80%93Macao_Greater_Bay_Area cite note ReferenceB 17 In addition, it is expected to play a key role in Belt and Road Initiative https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Belt_and_Road_Initiative "Belt and Road Initiative" by connecting southern China with the countries along the 21st Century Maritime Silk Road https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/21st_Century_Maritime_Silk_Road "21st Century Maritime Silk Road" . 17 https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guangdong%E2%80%93Hong_Kong%E2%80%93Macao_Greater_Bay_Area cite note 18 The GBA is located in the southern coastal area of China, consisting of nine cities, or around 30% of the land mass, of the province of Guangdong, plus the Special Administrative Regions https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Special_Administrative_Regions "Special Administrative Regions" of Hong Kong and Macao. 18 https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guangdong%E2%80%93Hong_Kong%E2%80%93Macao_Greater_Bay_Area cite note ReferenceA 19 Its climate ranges from humid subtropical https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Subtropics "Subtropics" to tropical climate https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tropical_climate "Tropical climate" in the far south.

11-chunk_26_4863956684056671676.chunk_text: 18 https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guangdong%E2%80%93Hong_Kong%E2%80%93Macao_Greater_Bay_Area cite note ReferenceA 19 Its climate ranges from humid subtropical https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Subtropics "Subtropics" to tropical climate https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tropical_climate "Tropical climate" in the far south. There are a few mountain ranges https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mountain_range "Mountain range" collectively called the Nanling https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nanling "Nanling" as well as a few inactive volcanoes https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Volcanoes "Volcanoes" on Leizhou Peninsula https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leizhou_Peninsula "Leizhou Peninsula" . Mountain ranges and peninsulas shape the GBA. The province of Guangdong, for instance, possesses a coastline of 4,114 km 2,556 mi due to the multiplicity of islands, bays and peninsulas.

11-chunk_27_3618134845670570064.chunk_text: The province of Guangdong, for instance, possesses a coastline of 4,114 km 2,556 mi due to the multiplicity of islands, bays and peninsulas. This multiplicity of small islands results from the Pearl River Delta https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pearl_River_Delta "Pearl River Delta" , which is the convergent point of the East, North and West Rivers. The network of bays and rivers has contributed to the archipelagic nature of many cities within the GBA. The cities of Guangzhou, Zhuhai, Hong Kong, and Macao for instance "each possess constituent and distinctly islanded territorial niches that are focused on particular industrial areas.

11-chunk_28_7121107781478601197.chunk_text: The cities of Guangzhou, Zhuhai, Hong Kong, and Macao for instance "each possess constituent and distinctly islanded territorial niches that are focused on particular industrial areas. " 19 https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guangdong%E2%80%93Hong_Kong%E2%80%93Macao_Greater_Bay_Area cite note 20 The entire area has temperate springs March to May , hot and wet summers June to August , clear and cool autumns September to November , and mild, rainy winters December to February . The annual average temperature of Guangdong Province is around 22.

11-chunk_29_-1208991738043305174.chunk_text: The annual average temperature of Guangdong Province is around 22. 3°C 72. 1°F , with the average temperature of 16–19°C 61–66°F in January and 28–29°C 82–84°F in July. However, the highest temperature in summer goes more than 35°C 95°F and the lowest can be lower than 10°C 50°F .

11-chunk_30_-2197502627524519608.chunk_text: However, the highest temperature in summer goes more than 35°C 95°F and the lowest can be lower than 10°C 50°F . Temperatures in Hong Kong and Macao are nearly the same, with the annual average temperature around 23°C 73°F , a little higher due to their location more to the south and closer to the equator. GBA receives abundant amount of precipitation throughout the year. In 2019, GBA has a total population of approximately 86.

11-chunk_55_5082811508276817640.chunk_text: edit https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Guangdong%E2%80%93Hong_Kong%E2%80%93Macao_Greater_Bay_Area&action=edit&section=7 "Edit section: Outline Development Plan" The Outline Development Plan for the Guangdong Hong Kong Macao Greater Bay Area , released by the Chinese central government in February 2019, outlines the integration of nine cities in Guangdong's Pearl River Delta https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pearl_River_Delta "Pearl River Delta" with Hong Kong https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hong_Kong "Hong Kong" and Macau https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Macau "Macau" into a unified economic region. The plan sets milestones aimed at establishing the Greater Bay Area as a globally competitive business hub by 2022, with further development into an international first class bay area by 2035, emphasizing reform, innovation, connectivity, and environmental sustainability. 18 https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guangdong%E2%80%93Hong_Kong%E2%80%93Macao_Greater_Bay_Area cite note ReferenceA 19

11-chunk_56_4863956684056671676.chunk_text: 18 https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guangdong%E2%80%93Hong_Kong%E2%80%93Macao_Greater_Bay_Area cite note ReferenceA 19 The plan includes major infrastructure initiatives such as the development of an international airport cluster, inter city high speed rail, and expressways, including the construction of two new bridges across the Pearl River Delta. In response to environmental concerns, the plan also emphasizes ecological conservation and the promotion of green and low carbon https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Low-carbon_economy "Low carbon economy" development models. The overarching goal is to transform the GBA into a service oriented economy.

11-chunk_57_806634385099967376.chunk_text: The overarching goal is to transform the GBA into a service oriented economy. 18 https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guangdong%E2%80%93Hong_Kong%E2%80%93Macao_Greater_Bay_Area cite note ReferenceA 19 The GBA development strategy assigns specific roles to its four core cities based on their comparative advantages: Hong Kong will focus on enhancing its status as an international financial and logistics hub; Macau will develop as a center for tourism, leisure, cultural exchange, and trade with Portuguese speaking countries https://en.wikipedia. Collectively, these specializations aim to transform the GBA into a globally competitive city cluster.

Further step in GBA's infrastructure development is establishment of airport clusters. Guangdong Province has also formally proposed to introduce a credit scoring system to cover Hong Kong and Macao in the next three years, with a view to sharing credit information in the Greater Bay Area and providing credit incentives and sanctions for enterprises in the region. There are also plans to promote information sharing between the Mainland, Hong Kong and Macao, and to strengthen police cooperation and exchanges to deal with security threats. Being part of the Silk Road https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Silk_Road "Silk Road" as well as Chinese international marine https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ocean "Ocean" gates and trade hotspot for the last two thousand years, GBA has rich cultural https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Culture "Culture" and folk https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Folk_culture "Folk culture" traditions, languages, and food.

11-chunk_97_6999160144350688709.chunk_text: Being part of the Silk Road https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Silk_Road "Silk Road" as well as Chinese international marine https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ocean "Ocean" gates and trade hotspot for the last two thousand years, GBA has rich cultural https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Culture "Culture" and folk https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Folk_culture "Folk culture" traditions, languages, and food. Among them, a distinct European ambience – the Cantonese culture https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lingnan_culture "Lingnan culture" with its center in Guangzhou https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guangzhou "Guangzhou" , Macau https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Macau "Macau" , eastern Guangxi https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guangxi "Guangxi" , and Hong Kong https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hong_Kong "Hong Kong" . There are many notable foods in Hong Kong, the most famous of which are pineapple oil https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E8%8F%A0%E8%98%BF%E6%B2%B9 "wiktionary:菠蘿油" , cart noodles https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cart_noodle "Cart noodle" , egg waffles https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Egg_waffle "Egg waffle" and Hong Kong style milk tea https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hong_Kong%E2%80%93style milk tea "Hong Kong–style milk tea" . A local's day usually starts with a bowl of fish ball noodles or wonton noodles and a cup of soy milk.

11-chunk_98_4769303562467648863.chunk_text: A local's day usually starts with a bowl of fish ball noodles or wonton noodles and a cup of soy milk. Notable foods in Macao are egg tarts https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Egg_tart "Egg tart" , Chicken cakes https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Chicken_cakes&action=edit&redlink=1 "Chicken cakes page does not exist " zh https://zh.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E9%B8%A1%E4%BB%94%E9%A5%BC "zh:鸡仔饼" and pork jerky https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bakkwa "Bakkwa" . Hong Kong and Macau also has its distinct local culture, largely based on Cantonese culture, but also heavily influenced by British and Portuguese https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Portugal "Portugal" colonisation over the past two centuries. The distinct feature of Cantonese culture https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cantonese culture "Cantonese culture" is the Cantonese language https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cantonese "Cantonese" and Cantonese cuisine https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cantonese cuisine "Cantonese cuisine" .

14-chunk_52_1930602918443554357.chunk_text: OVERVIEW OF THE GUANGDONG HONG KONG MACAO GREATER BAY AREA 1. 1 GEOGRAPHY AND POPULATION

14-chunk_53_3249990475954979276.chunk_text: 1 GEOGRAPHY AND POPULATION 1. 1. 1 Geographical location and transportation advantages

14-chunk_54_3956697034883746509.chunk_text: 1 Geographical location and transportation advantages The Guangdong Hong Kong Macao Greater Bay Area occupies a strategically advantageous position along the southern coast of China, encompassing the Pearl River Delta region and adjoining areas. Its geographical location at the nexus of the Asia Pacific region endows it with strong connectivity and access to global markets. 1.

14-chunk_56_-2227060657812781525.chunk_text: 1 Geographical Location Spanning approximately 56,000 square kilometers, the Greater Bay Area encompasses nine cities in Guangdong Province, as well as the two Special Administrative Regions of Hong Kong and Macao. Situated at the heart of the Asia Pacific region, the Greater Bay Area serves as a gateway to mainland China and a bridge between East and West, facilitating trade, investment, and cultural exchanges. 1.

14-chunk_58_6603854912115450077.chunk_text: 2 Transportation Advantages The Greater Bay Area benefits from a comprehensive transportation network, comprising air, sea, and land routes, which enhances its accessibility and connectivity. • Air Transportation: The region is served by multiple international airports, including Hong Kong International Airport, Guangzhou Baiyun International Airport, and Shenzhen Bao'an International Airport, facilitating convenient air travel both domestically and internationally. • Sea Transportation: Home to some of the world's busiest ports, such as the Port of Shenzhen and the Port of Hong Kong, the Greater Bay Area is a critical hub for maritime trade and logistics, offering efficient shipping routes to global destinations.

14-chunk_59_-5130637462867282855.chunk_text: • Sea Transportation: Home to some of the world's busiest ports, such as the Port of Shenzhen and the Port of Hong Kong, the Greater Bay Area is a critical hub for maritime trade and logistics, offering efficient shipping routes to global destinations. • Land Transportation: High speed rail networks, expressways, and cross border bridges, such as the Hong Kong Zhuhai Macao Bridge, seamlessly connect the cities within the Greater Bay Area, facilitating the movement of goods, people, and capital across borders. 1. 1.

14-chunk_60_2669679046363060979.chunk_text: 1. 1. 3 Population Dynamics With a combined population exceeding 86 million, the Greater Bay Area boasts a highly skilled and diverse workforce, drawing talent from across the region and beyond.

14-chunk_61_-6390681942002709031.chunk_text: With a combined population exceeding 86 million, the Greater Bay Area boasts a highly skilled and diverse workforce, drawing talent from across the region and beyond. The population density within the urban centers of the Greater Bay Area is among the highest globally, reflecting its status as a vibrant economic and cultural hub. ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// > page 6 of 41 Guangdong Hong Kong Macao Greater Bay Area July 2024

14-chunk_62_-1391888646565311460.chunk_text: > page 6 of 41 Guangdong Hong Kong Macao Greater Bay Area July 2024 1. 1. 2 Population distribution and urban planning

14-chunk_64_1710894830799247066.chunk_text: 2. 1 Population Distribution The Guangdong Hong Kong Macao Greater Bay Area is characterized by a dynamic and diverse population distribution, shaped by historical, economic, and geographical factors. Key aspects of population distribution within the region include:

14-chunk_65_-6935298375546660024.chunk_text: Key aspects of population distribution within the region include: Concentration in Urban Centers: The majority of the population is concentrated in the major urban centers of the Greater Bay Area, including Guangzhou, Shenzhen, Hong Kong, and Macao. These cities serve as economic hubs and attract a significant influx of migrants seeking employment opportunities, higher education, and a vibrant urban lifestyle. Rural Urban Migration: The region has witnessed significant rural urban migration, with millions of individuals migrating from rural areas to urban centers in search of better livelihoods and socio economic prospects.

14-chunk_66_-5450890455635761817.chunk_text: Rural Urban Migration: The region has witnessed significant rural urban migration, with millions of individuals migrating from rural areas to urban centers in search of better livelihoods and socio economic prospects. This demographic trend has contributed to the rapid urbanization and expansion of metropolitan areas within the Greater Bay Area. International Migration: Hong Kong and Macao, as Special Administrative Regions with distinct legal and immigration frameworks, attract a sizable expatriate population and international migrants, further enriching the cultural diversity of the region. 1.

14-chunk_68_7687412589493774709.chunk_text: 2 Urban Planning Urban planning plays a crucial role in shaping the sustainable development and livability of the Greater Bay Area. Key aspects of urban planning initiatives within the region include: • Integrated Development: Efforts are underway to promote integrated urban development across the Greater Bay Area, fostering connectivity and collaboration among cities.

14-chunk_69_-5195343758528545308.chunk_text: • Integrated Development: Efforts are underway to promote integrated urban development across the Greater Bay Area, fostering connectivity and collaboration among cities. This includes coordinated land use planning, transportation infrastructure development, and environmental conservation measures. • Smart City Initiatives: The Greater Bay Area is at the forefront of smart city initiatives, leveraging technology and innovation to enhance urban efficiency, sustainability, and quality of life. Smart transportation systems, digital governance platforms, and eco friendly urban solutions are being implemented to address urban challenges and improve urban resilience.

14-chunk_70_1650311019497251028.chunk_text: Smart transportation systems, digital governance platforms, and eco friendly urban solutions are being implemented to address urban challenges and improve urban resilience. • Green and Low Carbon Urban Development: Sustainable urban development practices, including green building design, renewable energy integration, and low carbon transportation systems, are prioritized to mitigate environmental impacts and promote eco friendly urban lifestyles. • Social and Cultural Infrastructure: Urban planning efforts encompass the development of social and cultural infrastructure, including public amenities, recreational spaces, and cultural institutions, to enhance the quality of urban life and promote community well being. //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

14-chunk_72_4790943255908886290.chunk_text: 2 OVERVIEW OF REGIONAL ECONOMY 1. 2. 1 Economic aggregate and growth trends

14-chunk_73_-200157254872211971.chunk_text: 1 Economic aggregate and growth trends The Guangdong Hong Kong Macao Greater Bay Area stands as a pivotal economic powerhouse within China, characterized by its significant economic aggregate and sustained growth trends. Recent data indicates that the region's economic aggregate has surpassed 13 trillion RMB 2022 , demonstrating robust and continuous expansion. Over the past several years, the Greater Bay Area has consistently maintained an annual economic growth rate exceeding 5 percent 2022 ） ,showcasing its strong developmental momentum.

14-chunk_74_849131377907058799.chunk_text: Over the past several years, the Greater Bay Area has consistently maintained an annual economic growth rate exceeding 5 percent 2022 ） ,showcasing its strong developmental momentum. This growth is underpinned by a diverse array of economic activities spanning the advanced manufacturing, modern services, innovation, and technology sectors, among others. The region is characterized by economic dynamism driven by a synergistic interaction between various industries and cross border collaborations. Industrial structure and key development areas

14-chunk_75_-5036319728978324578.chunk_text: Industrial structure and key development areas The industrial structure of the Guangdong Hong Kong Macao Greater Bay Area is characterized by its diversification and innovation driven nature. It encompasses a wide range of sectors, including but not limited to: • Advanced Manufacturing: The region boasts a sophisticated manufacturing ecosystem, encompassing industries such as electronics, automobiles, machinery, and new materials.

14-chunk_76_-7287264009538647242.chunk_text: • Advanced Manufacturing: The region boasts a sophisticated manufacturing ecosystem, encompassing industries such as electronics, automobiles, machinery, and new materials. With a focus on technological innovation and efficiency enhancement, advanced manufacturing serves as a cornerstone of the Greater Bay Area's economic landscape. • Modern Services: As a global financial and commercial hub, the Greater Bay Area hosts a thriving services sector. This includes finance, trade, logistics, tourism, and professional services.

14-chunk_77_-6716329761158471878.chunk_text: This includes finance, trade, logistics, tourism, and professional services. Hong Kong and Macao, in particular, play pivotal roles in financial services and tourism, leveraging their international connectivity and expertise. • Innovation and Technology: The Greater Bay Area is at the forefront of innovation and technology, fostering the development of cutting edge industries such as artificial intelligence, biotechnology, fintech, and smart manufacturing. With robust governmental support and a vibrant start up ecosystem, the region is poised to become a global innovation hub.

14-chunk_78_-7399371409265989467.chunk_text: With robust governmental support and a vibrant start up ecosystem, the region is poised to become a global innovation hub. • Infrastructure and Connectivity: Infrastructure development, including transportation, telecommunications, and urban infrastructure, is a key priority for the Greater Bay Area. Initiatives such as the Hong Kong Zhuhai Macao Bridge and the Guangzhou Shenzhen Hong Kong Express Rail Link enhance connectivity and facilitate the flow of goods, services, and talents across the region. • Green Development: In alignment with national strategies for sustainable development, the Greater Bay Area is committed to promoting green and low carbon industries.

14-chunk_79_7866306644408969773.chunk_text: • Green Development: In alignment with national strategies for sustainable development, the Greater Bay Area is committed to promoting green and low carbon industries. Efforts are underway to develop renewable energy, promote energy efficiency, and mitigate environmental pollution, fostering a more sustainable and resilient economy. These key development areas underscore the Greater Bay Area's commitment to fostering innovation, enhancing competitiveness, and achieving sustainable growth in the global economy. //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

14-chunk_81_7508734045649997657.chunk_text: 3 ADMINISTRATIVE DIVISIONS 1. 3. 1 The respective characteristics of Guangdong Province, Hong Kong

14-chunk_82_-3037911620549452226.chunk_text: 1 The respective characteristics of Guangdong Province, Hong Kong Special Administrative Region and Macao Special Administrative Region 1.

14-chunk_84_-5563560348369332403.chunk_text: 1 Guangdong Province • Geographical Location and Economic Significance: Guangdong Province, located in southern China, serves as the economic powerhouse of the Greater Bay Area. It boasts a diverse economy, with a strong emphasis on manufacturing, trade, and services sectors.

14-chunk_85_2273809427862047323.chunk_text: It boasts a diverse economy, with a strong emphasis on manufacturing, trade, and services sectors. The province is home to numerous industrial clusters and export oriented enterprises, contributing significantly to China's GDP. • Population and Urbanization: With a population exceeding 126.

14-chunk_86_-5597966963433350902.chunk_text: With a population exceeding 126. 568 million, Guangdong is one of China's most populous provinces. Rapid urbanization has transformed Guangdong's urban landscape, with cities such as Guangzhou, Shenzhen, and Dongguan emerging as major metropolitan centers. • Innovation and Technology Hub:

14-chunk_87_3387947467765936918.chunk_text: • Innovation and Technology Hub: Guangdong is a hub for innovation and technology, with thriving technology parks, research institutions, and innovative ecosystems. It plays a pivotal role in driving China's technological advancement and industrial upgrading. 1.

14-chunk_88_1044625043080481042.chunk_text: 1. 3. 1. 2 Hong Kong Special Administrative Region SAR

14-chunk_89_-7348376670948772714.chunk_text: 2 Hong Kong Special Administrative Region SAR • Global Financial Center: Hong Kong SAR is renowned as a global financial center, characterized by its robust financial infrastructure, free market principles, and favorable business environment. It serves as a gateway for international capital flows and a hub for financial services, including banking, asset management, and insurance.

14-chunk_90_-5344198027270752088.chunk_text: It serves as a gateway for international capital flows and a hub for financial services, including banking, asset management, and insurance. • Rule of Law and Independent Judiciary: Hong Kong SAR upholds the rule of law and maintains an independent judiciary, which is distinct from mainland China's legal system. This legal framework provides businesses and individuals with confidence in the integrity and transparency of the legal system.

14-chunk_91_8199079532087910918.chunk_text: This legal framework provides businesses and individuals with confidence in the integrity and transparency of the legal system. ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// > July 2024 Guangdong Hong Kong Macao Greater Bay Area page 9 of 41 • Cultural Diversity and International Connectivity:

14-chunk_92_2946978845655342342.chunk_text: • Cultural Diversity and International Connectivity: Hong Kong SAR is a melting pot of cultures, with a vibrant blend of East and West. Its cosmopolitan atmosphere, world class amenities, and diverse culinary scene attract tourists and expatriates from around the globe. 1.

14-chunk_94_-7439660366251286568.chunk_text: 3 Macao Special Administrative Region SAR • Gaming and Tourism Hub: Macao SAR is renowned as the "Las Vegas of the East," with a thriving gaming and tourism industry. It is home to some of the world's largest casino resorts and entertainment complexes.

14-chunk_95_-4706585536138722074.chunk_text: It is home to some of the world's largest casino resorts and entertainment complexes. The tourism sector, bolstered by UNESCO World Heritage sites, cultural attractions, and international events, plays a vital role in Macao's economy. • Cultural Heritage and Fusion: Macao SAR boasts a rich cultural heritage, reflecting its unique blend of Chinese and Portuguese influences.

14-chunk_96_-286139329434145594.chunk_text: Macao SAR boasts a rich cultural heritage, reflecting its unique blend of Chinese and Portuguese influences. Historic landmarks, such as the Ruins of St. Paul's and Senado Square, coexist alongside modern developments, creating a distinctive urban landscape. • Diversification Efforts:

14-chunk_97_-3111933508432464983.chunk_text: • Diversification Efforts: Macao SAR is actively diversifying its economy beyond gaming and tourism, with initiatives to promote cultural and creative industries, conventions and exhibitions, and financial services. These efforts aim to enhance Macao's long term sustainability and resilience. //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

14-chunk_99_-215585077342322522.chunk_text: OVERVIEW OF INTERNATIONAL INVESTMENT AND TRADE IN THE GUANGDONG HONG KONG MACAO GREATER BAY AREA 2.

14-chunk_126_6825388011638086574.chunk_text: 1. 1 Market Access With Hong Kong and Macao serving as international trade and financial centers, Belgian exporters enjoy access to global markets through the GBA's extensive network and connectivity, facilitating cross border trade and business expansion. 2.

14-chunk_128_270922472799892426.chunk_text: 2 Cross border Collaboration The GBA promotes cross border collaboration and integration through initiatives such as the Greater Bay Area Development Plan and the Closer Economic Partnership Arrangement CEPA between Hong Kong and Mainland China. These frameworks facilitate the seamless movement of goods, services, capital, and talent, fostering closer economic ties and deeper cooperation between Belgium and the GBA. • The Development Plan: This comprehensive plan, released by the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and the State Council, covers the immediate period from 2019 to 2022 and extends to 2035 in the long term.

14-chunk_129_7046288375604380312.chunk_text: • The Development Plan: This comprehensive plan, released by the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and the State Council, covers the immediate period from 2019 to 2022 and extends to 2035 in the long term. The plan consists of 11 chapters detailing various aspects, such as the overall requirements, spatial layout, development of an international innovation and technology hub, infrastructural connectivity, a competitive industrial system, ecological conservation, a quality living environment, and cooperation under the Belt and Road Initiative. Key goals include transforming the bay area into a vibrant, world class city cluster, a global innovation hub, a key component of the Belt and Road Initiative, and a quality living circle. The plan focuses on leveraging the strengths of the core cities—Hong Kong, Macao, Guangzhou, and Shenzhen—as engines of regional development.

14-chunk_130_-293459365056637360.chunk_text: The plan focuses on leveraging the strengths of the core cities—Hong Kong, Macao, Guangzhou, and Shenzhen—as engines of regional development. By 2022, the objective is to establish the framework for an international first class bay area and a world class city cluster with a vibrant, innovative, and ecologically friendly environment. By 2035, the bay area is expected to have a development model driven by innovation, significantly enhanced economic and technological strengths, and increased international competitiveness. The Development Plan envisions improved living standards, social civility, cultural influence, and resource conservation, ultimately creating a first class living, working, and traveling environment.

14-chunk_131_-27662718705220017.chunk_text: The Development Plan envisions improved living standards, social civility, cultural influence, and resource conservation, ultimately creating a first class living, working, and traveling environment. ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// > July 2024 Guangdong Hong Kong Macao Greater Bay Area page 13 of 41 • The Closer Economic Partnership Arrangement CEPA : The Mainland and Hong Kong Closer Economic Partnership Arrangement CEPA is the first free trade agreement between Mainland China and Hong Kong, signed on June 29, 2003.

14-chunk_132_5584636783821928449.chunk_text: • The Closer Economic Partnership Arrangement CEPA : The Mainland and Hong Kong Closer Economic Partnership Arrangement CEPA is the first free trade agreement between Mainland China and Hong Kong, signed on June 29, 2003. CEPA enhances economic cooperation and market access for Hong Kong goods and services in Mainland China through a building block approach, introducing continuous liberalization measures. CEPA benefits both regions and foreign investors by opening new business opportunities. For Hong Kong, it offers greater access to the mainland market, while Mainland businesses use Hong Kong as a gateway to global markets.

14-chunk_133_5162595896718832212.chunk_text: For Hong Kong, it offers greater access to the mainland market, while Mainland businesses use Hong Kong as a gateway to global markets. Foreign investors can establish businesses in Hong Kong to leverage CEPA benefits. CEPA covers four main areas: o 1.

14-chunk_134_6184243246775044273.chunk_text: o 1. Trade in Goods: Zero tariff preference for Hong Kong origin goods entering the mainland, provided they meet CEPA rules of origin and are accompanied by a Certificate of Origin. It includes chapters on customs, sanitary measures, technical barriers, and trade facilitation in the Greater Bay Area. o 2.

14-chunk_135_-7912387073125315720.chunk_text: o 2. Trade in Services: Preferential market access for Hong Kong service suppliers in the mainland, with agreements on mutual recognition of professional qualifications. o 3. Investment: Preferential treatment for Hong Kong investors in non services sectors in the mainland, with provisions for investment promotion and protection.

14-chunk_152_-4230899423803492128.chunk_text: POLICY AND INSTITUTIONAL ENVIRONMENT OF THE GREATER BAY AREA 3. 1 POLICY FRAMEWORK OF THE GUANGDONG HONG KONG

14-chunk_153_-4663637719094487273.chunk_text: 1 POLICY FRAMEWORK OF THE GUANGDONG HONG KONG MACAO GREATER BAY AREA 3. 1.

14-chunk_154_-6827687741837195424.chunk_text: 1. 1 Regional integration policy and development planning The policy framework of the Guangdong Hong Kong Macao Greater Bay Area is characterized by a comprehensive approach to regional integration and development planning, aimed at fostering synergy, connectivity, and sustainable growth across the participating cities and regions. The GBA is guided by a regional integration policy that seeks to harmonize economic, social, and institutional frameworks among the nine cities in Guangdong Province Guangzhou, Shenzhen, Zhuhai, Foshan, Huizhou, Dongguan, Zhongshan, Jiangmen, and Zhaoqing and the two Special Administrative Regions of Hong Kong and Macao.

14-chunk_155_6705863664000330737.chunk_text: The GBA is guided by a regional integration policy that seeks to harmonize economic, social, and institutional frameworks among the nine cities in Guangdong Province Guangzhou, Shenzhen, Zhuhai, Foshan, Huizhou, Dongguan, Zhongshan, Jiangmen, and Zhaoqing and the two Special Administrative Regions of Hong Kong and Macao. The policy emphasizes cross border cooperation, coordination of development strategies, and alignment of policies and regulations to promote a seamless flow of goods, services, capital, and talent within the region. The Greater Bay Area Development Plan, issued by the Central Government of China in 2019, outlines key objectives, priorities, and initiatives for promoting integrated development, innovation driven growth, and international cooperation across the GBA. Local governments within the GBA develop their own city specific plans and initiatives aligned with the broader regional objectives.

14-chunk_156_8454241251520096490.chunk_text: Local governments within the GBA develop their own city specific plans and initiatives aligned with the broader regional objectives. These plans focus on leveraging local advantages, promoting industry clusters, and enhancing competitiveness while contributing to the overall development of the GBA. The policy framework emphasizes the development of key industries and strategic sectors that are vital for the GBA's economic transformation and global competitiveness. These industries include advanced manufacturing, financial services, technology and innovation, modern services, and cultural and creative industries.

14-chunk_157_-5399827570685497789.chunk_text: These industries include advanced manufacturing, financial services, technology and innovation, modern services, and cultural and creative industries. Special economic zones, innovation parks, and industrial clusters are established to concentrate resources, attract investment, and foster innovation and entrepreneurship in targeted industries, driving economic growth and industrial upgrading across the GBA. Infrastructure development is a cornerstone of the policy framework, intending to enhance connectivity, transportation efficiency, and spatial integration within the GBA. Major infrastructure projects, such as transport networks, logistics hubs, and information technology facilities, are prioritized to facilitate the seamless movement of goods, people, and information across the region.

14-chunk_177_-6606390254709955327.chunk_text: 1 Guangdong Pilot Free Trade Zone Policy The Guangdong Pilot Free Trade Zone FTZ policy is a strategic initiative designed to promote economic liberalization, trade facilitation, and investment promotion within the Guangdong Hong Kong Macao Greater Bay Area GBA . Key aspects of the policy include: 3.

These incentives may include tax breaks, land use privileges, and expedited administrative procedures, encouraging businesses to establish operations and invest in strategic sectors within the FTZ. 3.

14-chunk_185_4495602827255937955.chunk_text: 4 Innovation and Technology The FTZ fosters innovation and technology development by promoting collaboration between domestic and foreign enterprises, facilitating technology transfer, and providing support for research and development activities. 14-chunk_197_608855215126527291.chunk_text: INDUSTRIAL POLICIES AND DEVELOPMENT PRIORITIES IN THE GREATER BAY AREA 4. 1 FOREIGN INVESTMENT POLICY

14-chunk_198_2000916090565241367.chunk_text: 1 FOREIGN INVESTMENT POLICY Over recent years, the Greater Bay Area GBA in China has increasingly become a focal point for investors. The region has established itself as a center for technological advancement, finance, and trade. For instance, i n 2022, the utilized foreign direct investment FDI in the Guangdong Hong Kong Macao Greater Bay Area reached 165.

14-chunk_199_4271719321991607522.chunk_text: For instance, i n 2022, the utilized foreign direct investment FDI in the Guangdong Hong Kong Macao Greater Bay Area reached 165. 85 billion U. S. dollars.

14-chunk_200_8007906255677556520.chunk_text: dollars. That year, FDI of around 10. 63 billion U. S.

14-chunk_201_-8541432261203386134.chunk_text: S. dollars were utilized in Shenzhen, one of the fastest developing cities in the Greater Bay Area. 4. 1.

14-chunk_202_-9085402771971278315.chunk_text: 1. 1 Foreign investment access conditions and preferential policies 4. 1.

14-chunk_203_3218898819427777333.chunk_text: 1. 1. 1 Guangdong In 2022, the Department of Commerce of Guangdong Province launched the latest edition of Invest Guangdong during the 3rd Qingdao Multinationals Summit QMS .

14-chunk_204_-8477622621980644473.chunk_text: In 2022, the Department of Commerce of Guangdong Province launched the latest edition of Invest Guangdong during the 3rd Qingdao Multinationals Summit QMS . This guidebook serves as a comprehensive showcase of Guangdong's economic accomplishments and its enhanced business landscape, with a particular focus on key areas such as the Greater Bay Area, cooperation zones like Hengqin and Qianhai, trade, pivotal industries, and the emerging opportunities stemming from the Regional Comprehensive Economic Partnership RCEP . Guangdong has proactively reformed its market mechanisms to attract foreign investment, significantly improving market access, intellectual property rights IPR protection, government services, and governance based on the rule of law, all under the framework of the Foreign Investment Law of the People's Republic of China. This legislation, effective since January 1, 2020, consolidates and replaces three previous laws on foreign investment, providing better protection for the legitimate rights and interests of foreign investors while instituting more stringent regulations for the management of foreign invested projects.

14-chunk_205_7874309824082271056.chunk_text: This legislation, effective since January 1, 2020, consolidates and replaces three previous laws on foreign investment, providing better protection for the legitimate rights and interests of foreign investors while instituting more stringent regulations for the management of foreign invested projects. Under the new law, the process for establishing and modifying foreign invested enterprises has been streamlined, with companies only needing to register with the Enterprise Registration System overseen by the State Administration for Market Regulation. Moreover, significant reforms have been made to sectoral restrictions and equity limits, such as the opening up of nine sectors for wholly foreign owned enterprises and the lifting of restrictions on foreign equity limits for Chinese banks and financial asset management companies. Additionally, the Foreign Investment Law facilitates increased collaboration between law firms from Hong Kong or Macao and those from mainland China, along with trials of Hong Kong's management model in engineering construction.

14-chunk_206_3385914690446128310.chunk_text: Additionally, the Foreign Investment Law facilitates increased collaboration between law firms from Hong Kong or Macao and those from mainland China, along with trials of Hong Kong's management model in engineering construction. To incentivize significant foreign investment, various financial incentives have been introduced, including guaranteed returns from provincial finance funds, support for projects by Fortune Global 500 companies and global industry leaders, and one time awards for foreign funded multinational corporations contributing significantly to provincial finances. ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// > page 20 of 41 Guangdong Hong Kong Macao Greater Bay Area July 2024

14-chunk_207_-6665028419688593108.chunk_text: > page 20 of 41 Guangdong Hong Kong Macao Greater Bay Area July 2024 Furthermore, measures have been implemented to bolster the management of land use, particularly for manufacturing projects with substantial foreign investment and the establishment of headquarters or regional headquarters for major multinational corporations. 4. 1.

14-chunk_208_-4433949607403672924.chunk_text: 1. 1. 2 Macao Macau has the status of a Special Administrative Region of the People’s Republic of China PRC , established through a joint declaration between Portugal and the PRC in 1987.

14-chunk_209_745211213002325518.chunk_text: Macau has the status of a Special Administrative Region of the People’s Republic of China PRC , established through a joint declaration between Portugal and the PRC in 1987. The region boasts minimal tariffs and restrictions, offering a favorable business climate for foreign investors. The absence of foreign exchange controls on current capital international transactions further facilitates investment activities. Macau operates its own independent public finance system and enjoys a degree of self governance, although foreign and defense affairs fall under the responsibility of the central PRC government.

14-chunk_210_2895817653184494955.chunk_text: Macau operates its own independent public finance system and enjoys a degree of self governance, although foreign and defense affairs fall under the responsibility of the central PRC government. Economically, Macau's reliance on tourism, particularly gaming, and light manufacturing, including textiles and garments, presents profitable opportunities for investors. Notably, the gaming sector dominates inward foreign direct investment FDI , reflecting its significance in Macau's economy. Despite its attractiveness to foreign investors, Macau lacks specific foreign investment legislation, and there are generally no restrictions on foreign investment.

14-chunk_211_3990113436047476408.chunk_text: Despite its attractiveness to foreign investors, Macau lacks specific foreign investment legislation, and there are generally no restrictions on foreign investment. Both overseas and domestic corporations are subject to the same regulatory framework, primarily governed by the Macau Commercial Code. However, certain sectors, such as education, legal services, and newspapers, have limited foreign control limits. Foreign investors commonly establish their presence in Macau through local branches.

14-chunk_212_7372068363838035231.chunk_text: Foreign investors commonly establish their presence in Macau through local branches. 14-chunk_230_702784908924209352.chunk_text: 4. 2. 1 Tax preferential policies and tax transparency The Guangdong Hong Kong Macao Greater Bay Area has distinctive qualities that bear promise for its development.

14-chunk_231_-4328876436410628343.chunk_text: The Guangdong Hong Kong Macao Greater Bay Area has distinctive qualities that bear promise for its development. Upon the basis of “one country, two systems”, the GBA consists of three customs territories and four core cities. As compared to other development areas, it is uniquely positioned geographically and has the unusual advantage of a fused eastern and western heritage. Along with mutual access to its financial markets, a good ecology, a thriving capital market, and generations of multilingual professional talent, the GBA offers favorable conditions for entrepreneurs to succeed in enterprise and wealth creation.

14-chunk_232_6562679540996403632.chunk_text: Along with mutual access to its financial markets, a good ecology, a thriving capital market, and generations of multilingual professional talent, the GBA offers favorable conditions for entrepreneurs to succeed in enterprise and wealth creation. 14-chunk_233_-9187933075162685695.chunk_text: 2. 1. 1 IIT Individual Income Tax In an attempt to attract more foreign professionals to work in the Guangdong Hong Kong Macao Greater Bay Area GBA , a Notice was jointly issued on March 14, 2019, by the Ministry of Finance and the State Administration of Taxation, granting Individual Income Tax IIT subsidies to overseas high end talent and those in short supply working in the GBA Circular 31 .

14-chunk_234_824984776815627401.chunk_text: In an attempt to attract more foreign professionals to work in the Guangdong Hong Kong Macao Greater Bay Area GBA , a Notice was jointly issued on March 14, 2019, by the Ministry of Finance and the State Administration of Taxation, granting Individual Income Tax IIT subsidies to overseas high end talent and those in short supply working in the GBA Circular 31 . Following the essence of Circular 31, the Department of Finance of Guangdong Province and the Guangdong Provincial Tax Service under the State Administration of Taxation released a Notice on Implementing the IIT Preferential Policies in the GBA on June 22, 2019. These IIT preferential policies have been in place in Hengqin, the New District of Zhuhai, and the Qianhai District of Shenzhen since 2013. Now, they have expanded to cover nine cities in the GBA, including Guangzhou, Shenzhen, Zhuhai, Foshan, Huizhou, Dongguan, Zhongshan, Jiangmen, and Zhaoqing.

14-chunk_235_-3227506002806469378.chunk_text: Now, they have expanded to cover nine cities in the GBA, including Guangzhou, Shenzhen, Zhuhai, Foshan, Huizhou, Dongguan, Zhongshan, Jiangmen, and Zhaoqing. The GBA IIT subsidy aims to support overseas high end and in demand talent working in the Greater Bay Area. Under this program, the portion of IIT paid by an individual in one of the nine mainland cities of the GBA, exceeding the initial 15 percent of their taxable income, is subsidized by the respective municipal government. This subsidy is also exempt from further IIT.

14-chunk_236_7275408337178543119.chunk_text: This subsidy is also exempt from further IIT. The subsidy is capped at RMB 5 million approximately US$691,266 per taxpayer in a given tax year China’s tax year runs from January 1 to December 31 . The IIT preferential policies implemented in the nine GBA cities effectively balance the tax rate between Hong Kong salaries tax and IIT by providing subsidies to taxpayers. Initially set to expire //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

14-chunk_237_-1443206703698633116.chunk_text: Initially set to expire ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// > July 2024 Guangdong Hong Kong Macao Greater Bay Area page 23 of 41 by the end of 2023, the subsidy is now extended until 2027. Recently, the Guangdong Provincial Department of Finance issued a notice to the municipal governments of the nine mainland GBA cities, initiating the procedures for the subsidy once again.

14-chunk_238_2131740420795375441.chunk_text: Recently, the Guangdong Provincial Department of Finance issued a notice to the municipal governments of the nine mainland GBA cities, initiating the procedures for the subsidy once again. • Benefits Eligible persons working in the GBA can obtain financial subsidies from the local governments in the form of IIT rebate. The rebate is calculated as the difference between the actual IIT paid by the applicant and 15 percent of his/her taxable income and it will not be treated as taxable income in the hands of the taxpayers.

14-chunk_239_7881957250957750742.chunk_text: The rebate is calculated as the difference between the actual IIT paid by the applicant and 15 percent of his/her taxable income and it will not be treated as taxable income in the hands of the taxpayers. The tax rate for an ordinary taxpayer is 45%, while the part above the 15% tax rate for the eligible person can be subsidized by the government. In other words, qualified persons can receive IIT subsidies of RMB 300,000 each year. • Eligibility

14-chunk_240_-5017129491990844983.chunk_text: • Eligibility The IIT preferential subsidies for eligible applicants in the GBA are made for overseas high end talent or talent in short supply who work in specific mainland cities within the Greater Bay Area GBA and meet certain criteria set by municipal governments. To qualify, individuals must be permanent residents of Hong Kong or Macao, Hong Kong residents with residency through specific programs, residents of Taiwan, foreign nationals, mainland Chinese returnees, or overseas Chinese with long term residence abroad. They must also work and pay taxes in one of the nine designated mainland cities, adhere to laws and regulations, and scientific research ethics, and be skilled in scientific and technological innovation, key development industries, or philosophy and social sciences as defined in each city's talent catalog.

14-chunk_241_-4431715977749973795.chunk_text: They must also work and pay taxes in one of the nine designated mainland cities, adhere to laws and regulations, and scientific research ethics, and be skilled in scientific and technological innovation, key development industries, or philosophy and social sciences as defined in each city's talent catalog. 4. 2. 1.

14-chunk_242_-3448467453529891929.chunk_text: 1. 2 Consumption tax Consumption tax applies to both entities and individuals engaged in the production, processing, contract work, or importation of goods subject to consumption tax regulations in China, as well as those selling such goods as specified by the State Council. These entities and individuals are considered consumption taxpayers and are required to remit consumption tax in accordance with the regulations.

14-chunk_243_7955838606603928417.chunk_text: These entities and individuals are considered consumption taxpayers and are required to remit consumption tax in accordance with the regulations. Taxable items include cigarettes, alcoholic beverages, cosmetics, fine jewelry, fireworks, refined oil products, luxury watches, yachts, motorcycles, tires, small cars, golf equipment, disposable wooden chopsticks, and wood floor panels. Tax rates for consumption items are determined by the Schedule of Consumption Tax Items and Rates, employing either proportional tax rates ranging from 5% to 35% or specific tax amounts ranging from RMB 0. 1 to 250.

14-chunk_244_-5107890882229198045.chunk_text: 1 to 250. The payable amount of consumption tax is calculated based on volume, value, or a combination of both methods. For volume based taxation, the tax payable equals the sales value multiplied by the proportional tax rate. For value based taxation, the tax payable equals the quantity of sales multiplied by the specific tax.

14-chunk_245_-3066053787119730930.chunk_text: For value based taxation, the tax payable equals the quantity of sales multiplied by the specific tax. For a combination method, the tax payable equals the sales value multiplied by the proportional tax rate plus the quantity of sales multiplied by the specific tax. Taxes payable on sales of taxable goods are calculated in renminbi. If calculated in a currency other than renminbi, it must be converted.

14-chunk_246_-5816554495530620970.chunk_text: If calculated in a currency other than renminbi, it must be converted. Taxes payable on imported taxable goods are calculated based on the composite taxable value. ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// > page 24 of 41 Guangdong Hong Kong Macao Greater Bay Area July 2024

14-chunk_249_2830751578093479417.chunk_text: 2. 1. 3 Stamp tax The stamp tax applies to both entities and individuals engaged in the execution of taxable certificates or securities transactions within Mainland China.

14-chunk_250_-2537070945458160509.chunk_text: The stamp tax applies to both entities and individuals engaged in the execution of taxable certificates or securities transactions within Mainland China. Additionally, entities or individuals outside Mainland China involved in the execution of taxable certificates utilized within Mainland China are also subject to stamp tax obligations. These taxpayers are required to comply with the regulations outlined in the Stamp Tax Law of the People’s Republic of China. "Taxable certificates" encompass contracts, property rights transfer certificates, and business account books specified in the Table of Taxable Items and Tax Rates attached to the Stamp Tax Law of the People’s Republic of China.

14-chunk_251_3500013305474731520.chunk_text: "Taxable certificates" encompass contracts, property rights transfer certificates, and business account books specified in the Table of Taxable Items and Tax Rates attached to the Stamp Tax Law of the People’s Republic of China. "Securities transactions" denote the transfer of stocks and stock based depositary receipts traded on legally recognized stock exchanges and other nationwide securities trading venues approved by the State Council. Calculation and tax rates are determined according to the Table of Taxable Items and Tax Rates attached to the Stamp Tax Law. Stamp tax payable is computed by multiplying the tax basis by the applicable tax rate.

14-chunk_252_-9187122658543217155.chunk_text: Stamp tax payable is computed by multiplying the tax basis by the applicable tax rate. The tax basis includes: • The contract amount, excluding listed value added tax, for taxable contracts, • The amount listed in property rights transfer certificates, excluding listed value added tax, for taxable property rights transfer certificates,

14-chunk_253_-4285698064659244982.chunk_text: • The amount listed in property rights transfer certificates, excluding listed value added tax, for taxable property rights transfer certificates, • The aggregate of paid up capital capital stock plus recorded capital reserves in business account books for taxable business account books, • The transaction value for securities transactions. Certain documents are exempt from stamp tax, such as duplicates or transcripts of taxable certificates, certificates concluded by foreign embassies, consulates, or representative offices of international organizations in China for premises acquisition, contracts by the Chinese People’s Liberation Army and the Chinese People’s Armed Police Force, sales contracts for agricultural means of production or agricultural products, and interest free loan contracts.

14-chunk_254_-4812995042724459653.chunk_text: Certain documents are exempt from stamp tax, such as duplicates or transcripts of taxable certificates, certificates concluded by foreign embassies, consulates, or representative offices of international organizations in China for premises acquisition, contracts by the Chinese People’s Liberation Army and the Chinese People’s Armed Police Force, sales contracts for agricultural means of production or agricultural products, and interest free loan contracts. Moreover, the State Council has the authority to prescribe stamp tax reduction or exemption in specific cases to address national economic and social development needs, such as meeting housing demands, enterprise restructuring, bankruptcy, and supporting small and micro ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// > July 2024 Guangdong Hong Kong Macao Greater Bay Area page 25 of 41 enterprise development.

14-chunk_255_171407707324788606.chunk_text: enterprise development. These reductions or exemptions must be submitted to the Standing Committee of the National People’s Congress for record keeping. 4. 2.

14-chunk_279_1069057012455851240.chunk_text: 1 PEARL RIVER DELTA CORE AREA 5. 1. 1 Zhuhai National High tech Zone

14-chunk_280_-1683259088695593526.chunk_text: 1 Zhuhai National High tech Zone The Zhuhai National Hi Tech Industrial Development Zone, established in 1992, was among the first 54 state level hi tech zones approved by the State Council. It tries to create an internationalized, market oriented, and law based business environment, promoting government process reengineering to support enterprises with "Hi tech Strength", "Hi tech Speed", and "Hi tech Temperature". 14-chunk_281_6411168319059735761.chunk_text: Located just one hour's drive from Shenzhen, it serves as a demonstration area for cooperation between Shenzhen and Zhuhai, facilitated by the Shenzhen Zhongshan Bridge scheduled to open in 2024. Several renowned German companies have established a presence there. Additionally, it is the second largest hub of universities in Guangdong Province, hosting institutions like Sun Yat sen University, Beijing Normal University, Beijing Institute of Technology, and the United International College. 5.

14-chunk_282_644742687391543412.chunk_text: 5. 1. 2 Guangzhou Nansha Free Trade Zone The China Guangdong Pilot Free Trade Zone was established by the State Council in December 2014, covering 116.

14-chunk_283_6127931971244003649.chunk_text: The China Guangdong Pilot Free Trade Zone was established by the State Council in December 2014, covering 116. 2 square kilometers and integrating existing bonded zones in Nansha New Area in Guangzhou, Qianhai and Shekou Subdistrict in Shenzhen, and Hengqin Subdistrict in Zhuhai. It's a significant move by the Chinese government to boost the economy, comparable to the establishment of the Shenzhen Special Economic Zone and the development of Pudong. The goal is to create an internationally competitive business environment to attract both domestic and foreign investment.

14-chunk_284_-5665206599059173925.chunk_text: The goal is to create an internationally competitive business environment to attract both domestic and foreign investment. The Nansha area of the Guangdong FTZ is divided into seven functional zones, with the Port Cluster being the largest at 15 square kilometers, housing various industries and infrastructure developments. ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// > July 2024 Guangdong Hong Kong Macao Greater Bay Area page 29 of 41

14-chunk_286_-607262022665548789.chunk_text: 3 Guangzhou Science City Guangzhou Science City, nestled within the vibrant landscape of Huangpu district, has ascended to the impressive second position among 348 contenders in the esteemed "Top 100 Science and Technology Cities 2023 " nationwide. This accolade underscores its status as a distinguished bastion of scientific and technological innovation, where a myriad of pioneering research institutions and cutting edge technology enterprises converge. Huangpu district has meticulously crafted the "2 3 N" strategic platform for scientific and technological innovation, a visionary framework that adeptly aggregates high caliber resources in the realm of science and technology.

14-chunk_287_2151510844518866080.chunk_text: Huangpu district has meticulously crafted the "2 3 N" strategic platform for scientific and technological innovation, a visionary framework that adeptly aggregates high caliber resources in the realm of science and technology. At the heart of this strategic initiative lies Guangzhou Science City, serving as a pivotal nexus for esteemed research institutions and top tier talent, emerging as a front runner in patent grants. Moreover, Guangzhou Science City has not only showcased remarkable prowess in fostering industrial advancement but has also emerged as a torchbearer in key domains such as intelligent manufacturing, next generation information technology, artificial intelligence, and biomedicine. The rise of Guangzhou Science City owes much to its unparalleled business ecosystem.

14-chunk_288_7854643781987349997.chunk_text: The rise of Guangzhou Science City owes much to its unparalleled business ecosystem. Huangpu district has consistently refined its policies and services, fashioning an environment conducive to the proliferation of innovative enterprises and entrepreneurial endeavors, thus cementing its stature as a beacon of innovation and progress. 5. 2 MACAO SPECIAL ECONOMIC ZONE

14-chunk_289_-672346798285570682.chunk_text: 2 MACAO SPECIAL ECONOMIC ZONE 5. 2. 1 Hengqin New District

14-chunk_290_5433393861094588935.chunk_text: 1 Hengqin New District On April 3, 2023, China's National Development and Reform Commission NDRC unveiled the Catalogue of Encouraged Industries in the Hengqin Guangdong Macao In Depth Cooperation Zone. This catalog outlines industries incentivized for investment and whose employees qualify for specific tax benefits within the Hengqin Guangdong Macao In Depth Cooperation Zone. Located in the Hengqin New Area, an island district in Zhuhai, Guangdong Province, the Hengqin Cooperation Zone sits adjacent to the Macao Special Administrative Region, connected by various transportation links like bridges, tunnels, and ferry routes.

14-chunk_291_-6676530712016758294.chunk_text: Located in the Hengqin New Area, an island district in Zhuhai, Guangdong Province, the Hengqin Cooperation Zone sits adjacent to the Macao Special Administrative Region, connected by various transportation links like bridges, tunnels, and ferry routes. Currently under construction, an extension of the Macao Light Rapid Transit system is expected to be operational by 2025, further facilitating cross border travel between the two regions. The Encouraged Industries Catalogue outlines sectors eligible for exclusive preferential individual income tax IIT policies within the Hengqin Guangdong Macao In Depth Cooperation Zone, aimed at attracting high end talent. Besides tax benefits, companies in these industries may qualify for other supportive policies like land allocation and funding.

14-chunk_292_3726656800000446682.chunk_text: Besides tax benefits, companies in these industries may qualify for other supportive policies like land allocation and funding. However, specific support policies beyond IIT benefits haven't been clarified yet. This move is an attempt to bolster the area's development and integrate Macao's economy with the Greater Bay Area by fostering key industries and attracting top talent. The catalogue comprises 185 sectors across five categories: Technology R&D and high end manufacturing, Macanese industries, Culture, tourism, exhibition, and business, Modern finance, and Others, spanning diverse fields such as integrated circuits, Chinese traditional medicine, digital cultural products, finance, education, and sports.

14-chunk_293_-527170484577773888.chunk_text: The catalogue comprises 185 sectors across five categories: Technology R&D and high end manufacturing, Macanese industries, Culture, tourism, exhibition, and business, Modern finance, and Others, spanning diverse fields such as integrated circuits, Chinese traditional medicine, digital cultural products, finance, education, and sports. ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// > page 30 of 41 Guangdong Hong Kong Macao Greater Bay Area July 2024 5.

14-chunk_295_1630383728164021176.chunk_text: 5. 3. 1 Hong Kong Science and Technology Parks The Hong Kong Science and Technology Parks HKSTP has for focus to make Hong Kong a regional hub for innovation and technology.

14-chunk_296_-6805124845028787415.chunk_text: The Hong Kong Science and Technology Parks HKSTP has for focus to make Hong Kong a regional hub for innovation and technology. Their main goal is to support industrial diversification by fostering innovation, technology, and entrepreneurship, growing the economy, creating job opportunities, enhancing Hong Kong's global status, promoting STEM fields, and building a sustainable future. HKSTP provides facilities for research and innovation, including spaces for startups and affordable housing. They aim to create an ecosystem that benefits Hong Kong and the region, offering investment opportunities, support for market adoption of technology, talent development, policy support, infrastructure, and fostering an innovation culture.

14-chunk_297_-8851653228014537932.chunk_text: They aim to create an ecosystem that benefits Hong Kong and the region, offering investment opportunities, support for market adoption of technology, talent development, policy support, infrastructure, and fostering an innovation culture. Their initiatives connect tech startups with investors, match technology solutions with industry needs, nurture talent, provide policy support, develop infrastructure, and promote an entrepreneurial spirit. The TecONE professional team provides guidance to companies of various sizes on leveraging government I&T funding and support initiatives. These include programs such as the Research Talent Hub RTH , Public Sector Trial Scheme PSTS , Enterprise Support Scheme ESS , Re industrialization Funding Scheme RFS , Technology Voucher Program TVP , Innovation and Technology Fund for Better Living FBL , HKSTP Student Internship Program Funding, Technology Talent Admission Scheme TechTAS , and others.

14-chunk_299_-6397010190014028780.chunk_text: 2 Hong Kong International Financial Center Hong Kong's status as a leading international financial center is underscored by its robust financial sector, which operates under transparent regulations aligned with global standards. With a workforce exceeding 277,000 individuals in the financial industry, accounting for 7. 6% of the working population, it's a significant contributor to Hong Kong's GDP, representing 21.

14-chunk_300_-2419326452712532001.chunk_text: 6% of the working population, it's a significant contributor to Hong Kong's GDP, representing 21. 3%. The city's strategic location at the heart of Asia fosters close financial integration with Mainland China and extensive global networks. Leveraging its sound legal system, competitive tax regime, and free flow of capital, Hong Kong offers a diverse range of financial products and boasts a large pool of financial talents.

14-chunk_301_-4875310532327103805.chunk_text: Leveraging its sound legal system, competitive tax regime, and free flow of capital, Hong Kong offers a diverse range of financial products and boasts a large pool of financial talents. China's rapid growth and opening up present undeniable opportunities, with the country poised to constitute 20% of global GDP by 2030. Hong Kong, as the gateway to Mainland China and the global hub for offshore renminbi business, facilitates a substantial portion of China's inward and outward direct investments. Furthermore, Hong Kong's strengths in banking, capital markets, and asset management position it as an all encompassing financial platform for global investors and institutions.

14-chunk_302_5970071094967279330.chunk_text: Furthermore, Hong Kong's strengths in banking, capital markets, and asset management position it as an all encompassing financial platform for global investors and institutions. This status extends to corporate treasury centers, which favor Hong Kong as a preferred location. To enhance its competitiveness further, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority HKMA has established a Market Outreach division, seeking to engage with stakeholders to capitalize on growth opportunities. These opportunities include Mainland China's financial markets, green finance, and fintech, leveraging Hong Kong's world class financial infrastructure.

14-chunk_303_-3996052861684437099.chunk_text: These opportunities include Mainland China's financial markets, green finance, and fintech, leveraging Hong Kong's world class financial infrastructure. ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// > July 2024 Guangdong Hong Kong Macao Greater Bay Area page 31 of 41 Looking ahead, Hong Kong positions itself as a forward looking hub, seizing opportunities from initiatives like the Belt & Road Initiative BRI and the Greater Bay Area GBA .

The BRI, focusing on connectivity and investment, aligns with Hong Kong's international expertise and network.
