43-chunk_0_-8085164893430056642.chunk_text: Title: URL Source: https://www.brandhk.gov.hk/docs/default-source/factsheets-library/hong-kong-themes/2024-06-17/gba_en_jun-2024.pdf Markdown Content: Guangdong Hong Kong Macao Greater Bay Area

43-chunk_1_-3577182949356872438.chunk_text: Guangdong Hong Kong Macao Greater Bay Area Overview The Guangdong Hong Kong Macao Greater Bay Area GBA is a vibrant city cluster that comprises the Special Administrative Regions SAR of Hong Kong and Macao, as well as nine municipalities in

43-chunk_2_4762006948133960884.chunk_text: Special Administrative Regions SAR of Hong Kong and Macao, as well as nine municipalities in Guangdong Guangzhou, Shenzhen, Zhuhai, Foshan, Huizhou, Dongguan, Zhongshan, Jiangmen and Zhaoqing . The total population in the GBA is over 86 million.

43-chunk_3_6730780394776602748.chunk_text: The total population in the GBA is over 86 million. Collectively, the GBA represent s a vibrant economic force with a GDP of over RMB 13 trillion in 2022 . Outline Development Plan for the Guangdong Hong Kong Macao Greater Bay Area Outline

43-chunk_4_1433881180424993691.chunk_text: Outline Development Plan for the Guangdong Hong Kong Macao Greater Bay Area Outline Development Plan The State Council promulgated the Outline Development Plan on February 18, 2019. The Plan covers the

43-chunk_5_-6622854167236274399.chunk_text: The Plan covers the period up to 2022 in the immediate term, extending to 2035 in the long term. Key strategies include:  Spatial layout : Building on the four core cities of Hong Kong, Macao, Guangzhou and Shenzhen as

43-chunk_6_7913389162454206999.chunk_text:  Spatial layout : Building on the four core cities of Hong Kong, Macao, Guangzhou and Shenzhen as core engines for regional development , leveraging the core cities’ comparative advantages in striving for excellence and achievements, and strengthening the radiating effect in leading the development of nearby regions .

43-chunk_7_-1165528671843465922.chunk_text: development of nearby regions .  Policy measures : Develop an I&T hub . Expedit e infrastructural connectivity .

43-chunk_8_-7696341288149037258.chunk_text: Expedit e infrastructural connectivity . Build a globally competitive modern industrial system . Tak e forward ecological conservation . Develop a quality living circle for living , for working and travelling .

43-chunk_9_2835520887624291023.chunk_text: Develop a quality living circle for living , for working and travelling . Strengthen co operation and jointly participat e in the Belt and Road Initiative . Jointly develop Guangdong Hong Kong Macao co operation platforms and implement the Outline Development Plan

43-chunk_10_-3953818824826378149.chunk_text: Outline Development Plan  Outline Development Plan : Support Hong Kong in consolidating and enhancing our status as international finance, transportation and trade centres as well as an international aviation hub .

43-chunk_11_-3677943732642591474.chunk_text: transportation and trade centres as well as an international aviation hub . Develop I&T industries . Establish Hong Kong as the centre for international legal and dispute resolution services in the Asia Pacific region , and a regional intellectual property IP trading centre

43-chunk_12_2043637467482817848.chunk_text: Asia Pacific region , and a regional intellectual property IP trading centre Outline of the 14th Five Year Plan for National Economic and Social Development of the People's Republic of China and the Long Range Objectives Throug h the Year 2035 14th Five Year Plan

43-chunk_13_-4057814389820319783.chunk_text: Year Plan The 14th Five Year Plan, formally approved by the National People’s Congress on March 11, 2021, provides a blueprint and action agenda for national development, covering 2021 2025 . Contents relating

43-chunk_14_-8443314077241773225.chunk_text: Contents relating to Hong Kong can be found in chapter 61 on maintaining the long term prosperity and stability of Hong Kong and Macao and chapter 31 on taking forward the development of the GBA actively and steadily . Main points include :

43-chunk_15_-7136108951359444709.chunk_text: Main points include :  Maintain Hong Kong’s long term prosperity and stabilit y.  Enhance Hong Kong’s competitive ness and advantages .  Tak e forward the GBA development actively and steadily, and support Hong Kong better integrate

43-chunk_16_7558618872876297134.chunk_text:  Tak e forward the GBA development actively and steadily, and support Hong Kong better integrate into the overall development of the country .  Deepen and widen mutual access between the financial markets of the Mainland and Hong Kong .  Support the development of an international I&T hub in the GBA .

43-chunk_17_-8803114247938861289.chunk_text:  Support the development of an international I&T hub in the GBA .  Tak e forward the development of major Guangdong Hong Kong Macao co operation platforms including the Lok Ma Chau Loop .  Strengthen co operation between the Mainland and Hong Kong on different fronts .

43-chunk_18_-528425491073565008.chunk_text:  Strengthen co operation between the Mainland and Hong Kong on different fronts .  Facilitat e young people in Hong Kong and Macao to study, work and start business in Mainland GBA cities .  Establish a brand of quality exchanges among the young people of Guangdong, Hong Kong and

43-chunk_19_-7360229399352099124.chunk_text:  Establish a brand of quality exchanges among the young people of Guangdong, Hong Kong and Macao, etc . Work focus of HKSAR Government  Consolidat e and enhanc e Hong Kong’s status as an international financial, transportation and trade

43-chunk_20_-3324174530130535172.chunk_text:  Consolidat e and enhanc e Hong Kong’s status as an international financial, transportation and trade centre , and a centre for international legal and dispute resolution services in the Asia Pacific region .  Enhance, establish and d evelop Hong Kong’s status as an international aviation and I&T hub , an East meets West Centre for International Cultural Exchange , and a regional IP trading centre .

43-chunk_21_7605970614191551886.chunk_text: East meets West Centre for International Cultural Exchange , and a regional IP trading centre .  Strengthen infrastructural connectivity .  Expand the development of Hong Kong’s strong sectors .  Foster youth innovation and entrepreneurship .

43-chunk_22_7047417829477517599.chunk_text:  Foster youth innovation and entrepreneurship .  Fully leverage Hong Kong’s international connections and networks to promote the GBA overseas and attract capital and talent to the zone. GBA Opportunities

43-chunk_23_-1061586112024106461.chunk_text: GBA Opportunities  Hong Kong can make use of the GBA as the best entry point to focus on Mainland opportunities and better integrate into the overall development of the country , enabling Hong Kong to proactively become a “participant” in domestic circulation and a “facilitator” of international circulati on in the

The governments of Guangdong and Hong Kong will draw on the implementation experience of the scheme and proactively study the extension of the scheme to a Hong Kong/Shenzhen land based boundary control point, so that Hong Kong

43-chunk_126_8712781891002630321.chunk_text: of the scheme to a Hong Kong/Shenzhen land based boundary control point, so that Hong Kong private cars can travel to both the eastern and western parts of Guangdong.  The Hong Kong Section of the Guangzhou Shenzhen Hong Kong Express Rail Link commenced services in September 2018, connecting Hong Kong to the over 40,000 km national high speed rail network.

43-chunk_127_-6524900483293690441.chunk_text: commenced services in September 2018, connecting Hong Kong to the over 40,000 km national high speed rail network. It connects to a total of 73 destinations in the Mainland, with 188 daily trips. In August 2023, the "Same day Flexi trip Arrangement” was

43-chunk_128_-7808159437336981495.chunk_text: In August 2023, the "Same day Flexi trip Arrangement” was launched for passenger s travelling between Hong Kong West Kowloon Station and Futian Station to enhance flexibility for passengers’ trip arrangement. In addition, “20 ride Ticket”

43-chunk_129_3971866267990972437.chunk_text: In addition, “20 ride Ticket” and “30 day Ticket” were introduced in January 2024 for train trips between Hong Kong West Kowloon Station and 10 Mainland destinations to allow frequent travellers to enjoy discounted fares, further promoting the “one hour living circle” in the GBA .

43-chunk_130_3782778386974824062.chunk_text: fares, further promoting the “one hour living circle” in the GBA .  The Task Force for Hong Kong ‑Shenzhen Co ‑operation on Cross ‑Boundary Railway Infrastructure is tak ing forward the Hong Kong Shenzhen Western Rail Link Hung Shui Kiu Qianhai and the Northern Link Spur Line .

43-chunk_131_-7885705829173306596.chunk_text: Kiu Qianhai and the Northern Link Spur Line .  SkyPier Terminal commenced operations in August 2023, while the "Fly Via Zhuhai HK" direct passenger transport service was launched in December 2023 to allow Mainland and internationa l passengers to travel between the Mainland and the world via Hong Kong

43-chunk_132_-5984376758296219812.chunk_text: internationa l passengers to travel between the Mainland and the world via Hong Kong International Airport HKIA under an “air land air” mode.  Develop automated car parks on the HZMB Hong Kong Port Island to allow self driving visitors from Guangdong and Macao to drive to Hong Kong via the HZMB and fly out of the HKIA

43-chunk_133_-3195533251357326693.chunk_text: visitors from Guangdong and Macao to drive to Hong Kong via the HZMB and fly out of the HKIA via SkyPier Terminal after parking, or enter Hong Kong after going through immigration clearance.  Set up an airside int ermodal cargo pier at HKIA and an upstream HKIA Logistics Park in

43-chunk_134_345428195166899373.chunk_text:  Set up an airside int ermodal cargo pier at HKIA and an upstream HKIA Logistics Park in Dongguan, to facilitate seamless transportation of export cargo from the Mainland to the HKIA for transshipment to overseas destinations. Similarly, international cargo can also be

43-chunk_135_-4592332793734372401.chunk_text: Similarly, international cargo can also be imported into the Mainland  The arrangement for Hong Kong Macao cross boundary goods vehicles using the HZMB was implemented in August 2023 where goods vehicles of Hong Kong and Macao can

43-chunk_136_176301488157513371.chunk_text: HZMB was implemented in August 2023 where goods vehicles of Hong Kong and Macao can transport goods between the two places via the HZMB.  Rationalise the Hong Kong Shenzhen land boundary control points by adjusting the functions and extending operating hours of some of these land boundary control points to progressively

43-chunk_137_5502318947049787325.chunk_text: and extending operating hours of some of these land boundary control points to progressively implement the “ East in East out, West in West out ” planning strategy for cross boundary goods transport .  Culture and Tourism: The Culture and Tourism Development Plan for the Guangdong Hong Kong

43-chunk_138_-6706613422697167451.chunk_text:  Culture and Tourism: The Culture and Tourism Development Plan for the Guangdong Hong Kong Macao Greater Bay Area sets out the directions for the overall cultural and tourism development of the GBA and guides the development of the GBA into an ex change hub for culture s of the East and the West and a world class tourism destination.

43-chunk_139_-1737611174217066581.chunk_text: the West and a world class tourism destination. It helps Hong Kong to further develop into a centre for arts and cultural exchange between China and the rest of the world as set out in the 14 th Five Year Plan and helps strengthen the positions of Hong Kong as an international cultural metropolis

43-chunk_140_-5254268605061409222.chunk_text: Year Plan and helps strengthen the positions of Hong Kong as an international cultural metropolis and tourism hub as well as a core demonstration zone for multi destination tourism .  Creative: Sponsor Hong Kong creative sectors to organise exhibitions, promotional acti vities in other GBA cities or co organise projects with their counterparts in the GBA through the

43-chunk_141_-8219161724930881442.chunk_text: other GBA cities or co organise projects with their counterparts in the GBA through the CreateSmart Initiative and the Film Development Fund to promote cross boundary exchanges and collaboration among creative industries.  Commerce: Launched a “GoGBA one stop platform ” via the HKTDC to provide multi faceted

43-chunk_142_3003025115488189372.chunk_text:  Commerce: Launched a “GoGBA one stop platform ” via the HKTDC to provide multi faceted support for Hong Kong enterprises, including market information and related government policies on the GBA, business enquiry servi ce, training, networking as well as promotion, and matching opportunities.

43-chunk_143_7684860670213371352.chunk_text: opportunities.  Education : Support and assist Hong Kong higher education institutions in providing joint education services in the GBA Mainland cities .  Youth Employment and Entrepreneurship : Launch ed the GBA Youth Employment

43-chunk_144_-4365123606168825477.chunk_text:  Youth Employment and Entrepreneurship : Launch ed the GBA Youth Employment Scheme , the Funding Scheme for Experiential Programmes at Innovation and Entrepreneurial Bases in the GBA and the Funding Scheme for Youth Entrepreneurship in the GBA to enhance the career development opportunities for young peo ple in the GBA .

43-chunk_145_-3816842214501087373.chunk_text: the GBA to enhance the career development opportunities for young peo ple in the GBA . A total of 1,091 young people have been employed through GBA Youth Employment Scheme. Th e

43-chunk_146_8354191231328383555.chunk_text: Th e Alliance of Hong Kong Youth Innovation and Entrepreneurial Bases in the Greater Bay Area was established in December 2023 to provide a one stop information, publicity and exchange platform to support Hong Kong youth entrepreneurs in the GBA .

43-chunk_147_5192517848445119132.chunk_text: platform to support Hong Kong youth entrepreneurs in the GBA .  Equine Industry : The HKSARG and the People's Government of Guangdong Province established the Guangdong Hong Kong Equine Industry Cooperation Task Force, with the Hong Kong Jockey Club as an expert member, to jointly promote the development of the equine sports and related

43-chunk_148_8115704546539840850.chunk_text: Club as an expert member, to jointly promote the development of the equine sports and related industries in the GBA , in alignment with the accelerated national transformation and upgrading of the equine industry.  Professional Services :

43-chunk_149_1720704786118386881.chunk_text:  Professional Services :  The Central Government promulgated the Qianhai Plan on September 6 , 2021 . The area of the Qianhai Shenzhen Hong Kong Modern Service Industry Cooperation Zone will be increa sed

43-chunk_150_1504653619076198532.chunk_text: Qianhai Shenzhen Hong Kong Modern Service Industry Cooperation Zone will be increa sed significantly from 14. 92 square kilometres to 120. 56 square kilometres .

43-chunk_151_7123440921371606979.chunk_text: 56 square kilometres . It also emphasises promoti ng high level opening up in Qianhai, fostering innovative development of modern service industries, and accelerati ng the building of a system of modern services compatible with

43-chunk_152_22224102593301633.chunk_text: service industries, and accelerati ng the building of a system of modern services compatible with Hong Kong and international standards. The Zone announced nine Hong Kong related facilitation measures in June 2022 covering areas such as youth innovation and

43-chunk_153_-4203148423164934149.chunk_text: facilitation measures in June 2022 covering areas such as youth innovation and entrepreneurship, technology development, financial services, legal services and medical services. These measures will provide support to Hong K ong people and enterprises developing

43-chunk_154_-6350647466027738869.chunk_text: These measures will provide support to Hong K ong people and enterprises developing in Qianhai and bring greater convenience to young people of Hong Kong and Macao seeking to develop their careers in Shenzhen.  The Department of Housing and Urban Rural Development of Guangdong Province promulgated

43-chunk_155_8376609799467961840.chunk_text:  The Department of Housing and Urban Rural Development of Guangdong Province promulgated “Int erim Guidelines for the Management of Hong Kong Engineering Construction Consultant Enterprises and Professionals Starting Business and Practising in the Guangdong Hong Kong Macao Greater Bay Area Cities” Interim Guidelines which allow consultant firms o n the two

43-chunk_156_-9024937253460608968.chunk_text: Macao Greater Bay Area Cities” Interim Guidelines which allow consultant firms o n the two government lists , as well as professionals registered with relevant registration boards in Hong Kong, to be able to directly provide services in the nine Mainland cities of the GBA by obtaining equivalent qualifications in the Mainland through a registration system.

43-chunk_157_-8606143054849645361.chunk_text: equivalent qualifications in the Mainland through a registration system. The Interim Guidelines , which took effect on January 1, 2021, cover four professional sectors : architecture, engineering, surveying and landscape architecture.

43-chunk_158_8963603787080721766.chunk_text: surveying and landscape architecture.  The “Management for Registration of Hong Kong and Macao Planning Profession al Enterprises Starting Businesses in Guangdong Province” and “Matters Concerning Planning Professionals Registered in Hong Kong and Macao Practising in Guangdong Province” , promulgated by the

43-chunk_159_-7930972596938004992.chunk_text: Registered in Hong Kong and Macao Practising in Guangdong Province” , promulgated by the Department of Natural Resources of Guangdong Province, took eff ect from September 1 and February 19, 2021 respectively. The relevant measures allow Hong Kong planning professional

43-chunk_160_4651889189024941221.chunk_text: The relevant measures allow Hong Kong planning professional enterprises as well as professionals registered with the Planners Registration Board in Hong Kong to directly provide services in Guangdong Province including the nine Mainland cities of the GBA after registration.

43-chunk_161_-205117443849157136.chunk_text: the GBA after registration. Similar measures have also been promulgated in Qianhai and Hengqin. Policy Measures by the Central Government

43-chunk_162_7809384424303168743.chunk_text: Policy Measures by the Central Government Since July 1, 2017, measures were introduced by the Central Government to facilitate Hong Kong people’s development in the GBA . Major facilitation policies and measures include:

43-chunk_163_-2405971439063363903.chunk_text: Major facilitation policies and measures include:  Mainland higher education institutions must accord equal treatment to Hong Kong and Macao students in admission, nurtur ing , management and support .  Remov e the requirement for people from Hong Kong and Macao to apply for employment permits

43-chunk_164_7229843017163888121.chunk_text:  Remov e the requirement for people from Hong Kong and Macao to apply for employment permits to work in the Mainland .  Allow Hong Kong and Macao people working in the Mainland to join the Housing Provident Fund . First plenary meeti ng of the Leading Group on August 15, 2018 : the Central Government introduced

43-chunk_165_-2765782551761740604.chunk_text: First plenary meeti ng of the Leading Group on August 15, 2018 : the Central Government introduced a resident permit to facilitate Hong Kong people’s development in the GBA . Second plenary meeting of the Leading Group on March 1, 2019 : eight measures were announced :  The method for calculating “183 days ” for paying individual income tax in the Mainland .

43-chunk_166_2996897367092797797.chunk_text:  The method for calculating “183 days ” for paying individual income tax in the Mainland .  Provid e tax relief by municipal governments to non Mainland inclu ding Hong Kong high end talent and talent in short supply .  Support the open recruitment of Hong Kong and Macao residents by public institutions in the GBA .

43-chunk_167_6369376842600452070.chunk_text:  Support the open recruitment of Hong Kong and Macao residents by public institutions in the GBA .  Encourag e innovation and entrepreneurship in the nine Mainland cities of the GBA by the youth of Hong Kong and Macao .  Support higher education institutions and scientific research institutes from Hong Kong and Macao

43-chunk_168_5751900228744176391.chunk_text:  Support higher education institutions and scientific research institutes from Hong Kong and Macao to participate in projects under Guangdong technology programmes .  Introduc e immigr ation facilitation reform pilot schemes in the GBA .  Facilitate vehicles from Hong Kong and Macao entering and exiting Mainland ports .

43-chunk_169_-8310348468361466970.chunk_text:  Facilitate vehicles from Hong Kong and Macao entering and exiting Mainland ports .  Expand the implementation scope of the connection with the Speedy Customs Clearance between Customs administrations . Third plenary meeting of the Leading Group on November 6, 2019 : 16 measures were announced :Policies and measures benefiting members of the public

43-chunk_170_5020277373143785073.chunk_text: Third plenary meeting of the Leading Group on November 6, 2019 : 16 measures were announced :Policies and measures benefiting members of the public  Facilitat e property purchases by Hong Kong residents in the Mainland cities of the GBA .  Support the use of mobile electronic payment by Hong Kong residents in the Mainland .  Pilot scheme for Hong Kong residents to open Mainland personal bank accounts in the GBA remotely

43-chunk_171_5971844381135796531.chunk_text:  Pilot scheme for Hong Kong residents to open Mainland personal bank accounts in the GBA remotely by attestation .  Ensur e that the children of Hong Kong and Macao residents enjoy the same education as those of Mainland residents .

43-chunk_172_-8732253600365795714.chunk_text: Mainland residents .  Explor e the establishment of a cross boundary wealth management scheme .  Facilitat e non Chinese Hong K ong permanent residents to travel to and from the Mainland cities in the GBA .

43-chunk_173_1947208361924983511.chunk_text: the GBA .  Permit the use of Hong Kong registered drugs and common medical devices in designated Hong Kong owned hea lthcare institutions in the GBA . Policies and measures supporting professional services

43-chunk_174_9191579995504420207.chunk_text: Policies and measures supporting professional services  Measures on partnership associations by Hong Kong and Mainland law firms, legal consultants and special examinations .  Further extend the scope of mutual recognition of qualifications for construction professionals .

43-chunk_175_7214720511829039953.chunk_text:  Further extend the scope of mutual recognition of qualifications for construction professionals .  Expand the scope of liberalisation measures for construction professionals from Hong Kong and Macao to practice in the Mainland .  Preferential treatment on insurance regulation .

43-chunk_176_-3097401749976599212.chunk_text:  Preferential treatment on insurance regulation .  Remov e the requirement on years of operating experience for Hong Kong service suppliers to provide insurance loss adjusting services in the Mainland .  Support bond market development in Hong Kong and Macao catastrophe bonds .

43-chunk_177_1581224992552015277.chunk_text:  Support bond market development in Hong Kong and Macao catastrophe bonds . Policies and measures supporting I&T development  Support the development of the Shenzhen Hong Kong Innovation and Technology Co operation Zone .

44-chunk_297_4069332186339938833.chunk_text:
Tuesday, May 16, 2023 Opportunities and challenges for southern China’s Greater Bay Area
! Image 7 https://www.ceibs.edu/sites/portal.prod1.dpmgr.ceibs.edu/files/VCG211362298131.jpg) By Zhao Xiande

44-chunk_298_-3399355971412091139.chunk_text: By Zhao Xiande The Guangdong Hong Kong Macao Greater Bay Area, as known as the Greater Bay Area GBA , is a world class urban agglomeration with the strongest market vitality in China. Covering 56,000 square kilometres, the 80 million resident region produced more than 11 trillion RMB in economic output in 2020. Since the return of Hong Kong and Macao to China, collaboration between the three regions has been deepened, leading to increased economic prowess and greater competitiveness.

44-chunk_299_-7121256812715156485.chunk_text: Since the return of Hong Kong and Macao to China, collaboration between the three regions has been deepened, leading to increased economic prowess and greater competitiveness. Major business layouts of the three regions Hong Kong focuses on finance, shipping, logistics and modern services. While home to many world class universities, however, it suffers from sluggish economic and social development due to difficulties in commercializing academic achievements and a lack of industrial resources.

44-chunk_300_7677206409006287213.chunk_text: While home to many world class universities, however, it suffers from sluggish economic and social development due to difficulties in commercializing academic achievements and a lack of industrial resources. Therefore, it should give play to its advantages in finance, shipping, logistics and modern services to better serve the GBA, while stepping up technology innovation to industrialise academic achievements. Macao is dominated by tourism and leisure. Similar to Hong Kong, its relatively singular economic structure coupled with small geographical area has led to slow growth.

44-chunk_301_5158866557087951485.chunk_text: Similar to Hong Kong, its relatively singular economic structure coupled with small geographical area has led to slow growth. Therefore, the government’s decision to allow Macao and Guangdong to jointly govern the 106 square kilometer Hengqin Island has provided needed land to help Macao diversify its economy and achieve sustainable development. Macao should focus on further exploring diversifying economic structures in Hengqin. Meanwhile, Guangdong’s nine major cities have large economic volume, and are well positioned to support emerging industries, advanced manufacturing and modern services.

44-chunk_302_8705964421077336031.chunk_text: Meanwhile, Guangdong’s nine major cities have large economic volume, and are well positioned to support emerging industries, advanced manufacturing and modern services. For Guangdong, the next step should be to promote its emerging industries, step up innovation and coordinate more development with other two regions. How can the three regions complement each other? The GBA can achieve greater coordination in a number of ways.

44-chunk_303_2424848310849893745.chunk_text: The GBA can achieve greater coordination in a number of ways. First, promoting the construction of the Guangzhou Shenzhen Hong Kong Macao Science and Technology Innovation Corridor to facilitate cross border exchange; second, strengthening capital market interconnection and further improving offshore and onshore markets; third, advancing judicial coordination mechanisms for intellectual property rights; fourth, boosting the coordinated development of shipping and Meanwhile, more consideration should also be given to the roles of Qianhai and Henqin to combine institutional innovation and industry development. The role of new infrastructure construction in developing the GBA

44-chunk_304_-6933433719038479140.chunk_text: The role of new infrastructure construction in developing the GBA From the perspective of supply chains, new infrastructure plays a critical role in the upgrade and transformation of the industrial and supply chains in the GBA in the following three ways: Firstly, to fill in the gap of China’s industrial and supply chains. Take chips, for example.

44-chunk_305_-2824554302032654737.chunk_text: Take chips, for example. Currently, China is dependent on overseas supplies which can easily be restrained. The technological innovation and industrial transformation of the GBA can propel the research and development of China’s chip industry by leveraging Hong Kong’s advantages in innovation and talent, as well as chip design enterprises such as Huawei and Hisilicon in Shenzhen. Secondly, to enhance the effective coordination of the GBA’s industrial and supply chains to improve the global competitiveness of products and services.

44-chunk_306_-455793664854374203.chunk_text: Secondly, to enhance the effective coordination of the GBA’s industrial and supply chains to improve the global competitiveness of products and services. The key is to integrate the supply chain mindset into the planning and development process of new infrastructure. For example, while digitally upgrading industrial parks, it is also necessary to plan and coordinate industrial and supply chains between different parks so as to create a sound ecology that integrates industry and finance. In the process of building intelligent logistics hubs such as airports, ports and distribution centres , we should also emphasis the digital networks of different supply chains, making sure they are manageable to help clients optimise the logistics supply chain based on data analysis.

44-chunk_307_-1752272937052106598.chunk_text: In the process of building intelligent logistics hubs such as airports, ports and distribution centres , we should also emphasis the digital networks of different supply chains, making sure they are manageable to help clients optimise the logistics supply chain based on data analysis. Thirdly, to promote the national ‘dual carbon’ goals. Taking charging stations of new energy vehicles as an example, at present, we still have a large number of public charging stations, with the vehicle pile ratio dropping to 2. 9:1.

44-chunk_308_4297775514154614350.chunk_text: 9:1. However, in practice, you will find that many public charging stations are slow to charge and some are even broken. Therefore, in the future, the GBA can tap into building high powered, fast charging stations and exploring new types of infrastructure such as battery swapping stations to assist the EV transformation. Zhao Xiande is the Professor of Operations and Supply Chain Management at CEIBS.

44-chunk_309_8863971784871125446.chunk_text:
Zhao Xiande is the Professor of Operations and Supply Chain Management at CEIBS. For more on his teaching and research interests, please visit his faculty profile here https://www.ceibs.edu/zhao-xiande)._ CONNECT WITH CEIBS

45-chunk_0_8537859803312736768.chunk_text: Title: URL Source: https://www.ceibs.edu/sites/portal.prod1.dpmgr.ceibs.edu/files/2023-03/zhao_xiande_opportunities_and_challenges_for_southern_chinas_greater_bay_area.pdf Published Time: Mon, 06 Mar 2023 09:12:58 GMT Markdown Content:

45-chunk_1_-8914132766638674583.chunk_text: Markdown Content: Opportunities and Challenges for Southern China’s Greater Bay Area T he Guangdong Hong Kong Macao Greater Bay Area, as known as the Greater Bay Area GBA , is a world class urban agglomeration with the strongest market vitality in China. Covering 56,000 square kilometres, the 80 million resident region produced more than 11 trillion RMB in economic output in 2020.

45-chunk_2_452629602660876253.chunk_text: Covering 56,000 square kilometres, the 80 million resident region produced more than 11 trillion RMB in economic output in 2020. Since the return of Hong Kong and Macao to China, collaboration between the three regions has been deepened, leading to increased eco nomic prowess and greater competitiveness. Major business layouts of the three regions Hong Kong focuses on finance, shipping, logistics and modern services.

45-chunk_3_-617317866411746358.chunk_text: Hong Kong focuses on finance, shipping, logistics and modern services. While home to many world class universities, however, it suf fers from sluggish economic and social devel opment due to difficulties in commercializing academic achievements and a lack of industri al resources.

45-chunk_4_-1141938349621727023.chunk_text: academic achievements and a lack of industri al resources. Therefore, it should give play to its advantages in finance, shipping, logistics and modern services to better serve the GBA, while stepping up technology innovation to industrialise academic achievements. Macao is dominated by tourism and leisure. Similar to Hong Kong, its relatively singu lar economic structure coupled with small geographical area has led to slow growth.

45-chunk_5_5351546755843436683.chunk_text: Similar to Hong Kong, its relatively singu lar economic structure coupled with small geographical area has led to slow growth. Therefore, the government’s decision to al low Macao and Guangdong to jointly govern the 106 square kilometer Hengqin Island has provided needed land to help Macao di versify its economy and achieve sustainable development. Macao should focus on further Zhao Xiande

45-chunk_6_-6115262657205815026.chunk_text: Zhao Xiande CEIBS Professor of Operations and Supply Chain Management and Associate Dean Shenzhen Campus CEIBS KNOWLEDGE 23

45-chunk_7_5437145736856819999.chunk_text: 23 The LINK Volume 2, 2022 exploring diversifying economic structures in Hengqin. Meanwhile, Guangdong’s nine major cities have large economic volume, and are well po sitioned to support emerging industries, ad vanced manufacturing and modern services. For Guangdong, the next step should be to promote its emerging industries, step up inno vation and coordinate more development with other two regions.

45-chunk_8_-1467392932844290216.chunk_text: For Guangdong, the next step should be to promote its emerging industries, step up inno vation and coordinate more development with other two regions. How can the three regions com plement each other? The GBA can achieve greater coordination in a number of ways. First, promoting the con struction of the Guangzhou Shenzhen Hong Kong Macao Science and Technology Inno vation Corridor to facilitate cross border ex change; second, strengthening capital market interconnection and further improving offshore and onshore markets; third, advancing judicial coordination mechanisms for intellectual prop erty rights; fourth, boosting the coordinated

45-chunk_9_-183714796887485805.chunk_text: First, promoting the con struction of the Guangzhou Shenzhen Hong Kong Macao Science and Technology Inno vation Corridor to facilitate cross border ex change; second, strengthening capital market interconnection and further improving offshore and onshore markets; third, advancing judicial coordination mechanisms for intellectual prop erty rights; fourth, boosting the coordinated Meanwhile, more consideration should also be given to the roles of Qianhai and Henqin to combine institutional innovation and industry development. The role of new infrastructure construction in developing the GBA From the perspective of supply chains, new in frastructure plays a critical role in the upgrade and transformation of the industrial and supply chains in the GBA in the following three ways:

45-chunk_10_2636414228031462435.chunk_text: From the perspective of supply chains, new in frastructure plays a critical role in the upgrade and transformation of the industrial and supply chains in the GBA in the following three ways: Firstly, to fill in the gap of China’s industrial and supply chains. Take chips, for example.

45-chunk_11_-2772542601254384749.chunk_text: Take chips, for example. Currently, China is dependent on overseas sup plies which can easily be restrained. The tech nological innovation and industrial transfor mation of the GBA can propel the research and development of China’s chip industry by lev eraging Hong Kong’s advantages in innovation and talent, as well as chip design enterprises such as Huawei and Hisilicon in Shenzhen. F o r G u a n g d o n g , t h e n e x t step should be to promote its emerging industries, step up innovation and coordinate

45-chunk_12_5657483321572703189.chunk_text: F o r G u a n g d o n g , t h e n e x t step should be to promote its emerging industries, step up innovation and coordinate more development with Hong Kong and Macao. > CEIBS KNOWLEDGE

45-chunk_13_-3024735146238964301.chunk_text: > CEIBS KNOWLEDGE 24 > The LINK Volume 2, 2022 Secondly, to enhance the effective coordina tion of the GBA’s industrial and supply chains to improve the global competitiveness of prod ucts and services.

45-chunk_14_-8189789301504174074.chunk_text: Secondly, to enhance the effective coordina tion of the GBA’s industrial and supply chains to improve the global competitiveness of prod ucts and services. The key is to integrate the supply chain mindset into the planning and de velopment process of new infrastructure. For example, while digitally upgrading industrial parks, it is also necessary to plan and coor dinate industrial and supply chains between different parks so as to create a sound ecology that integrates industry and finance.

45-chunk_15_-3703887678063602805.chunk_text: that integrates industry and finance. In the pro cess of building intelligent logistics hubs such as airports, ports and distribution centres , we should also emphasis the digital networks of different supply chains, making sure they are manageable to help clients optimise the logis tics supply chain based on data analysis. Thirdly, to promote the national ‘dual car bon’ goals. Taking charging stations of new energy vehicles as an example, at present, we still have a large number of public charging stations, with the vehicle pile ratio dropping to 2.

45-chunk_16_9155826552946784924.chunk_text: Taking charging stations of new energy vehicles as an example, at present, we still have a large number of public charging stations, with the vehicle pile ratio dropping to 2. 9:1. However, in practice, you will find that many public charging stations are slow to charge and some are even broken. Therefore, in the future, the GBA can tap into building high powered, fast charging stations and ex ploring new types of infrastructure such as battery swapping stations to assist the EV transformation.

45-chunk_final_4297775514154614350.chunk_text: 9:1. However, in practice, you will find that many public charging stations are slow to charge and some are even broken. Therefore, in the future, the GBA can tap into building high powered, fast charging stations and ex ploring new types of infrastructure such as battery swapping stations to assist the EV transformation. > CEIBS KNOWLEDGE
